task.title: Adjusting Connecting Rod Bearings
task.shortdesc: Follow these steps to adjust connecting rod bearings without removing the engine. This is a precision procedure that should ideally be performed by an expert mechanic.

prereq.note: Improper adjustment of connecting rod bearings can lead to rapid bearing wear, crystallization of the crankshaft, and severe engine damage.

context.p: For professional rebabbitting services, connecting rods can be sent to the nearest dealer or branch house for a fee of $1.00 each.
context.note: Do not attempt to rebabbitt connecting rods or main bearings without proper equipment, as satisfactory results require a special jig.

step.cmd: Drain the oil from the engine
Remove the bottom plate from the crank case to expose the connecting rods

substep.cmd: Remove the first connecting rod cap
Carefully draw-file the ends a small amount at a time

info.note: Ensure file marks correspond when reassembling

substep.cmd: Replace the cap and tighten bolts until snug against shaft

info.p: Test using one of these methods:

ul.li: Turn engine over using the starting handle
Experienced mechanics may test by lightly tapping each side of cap with hammer

substep.cmd: Loosen the bearing and repeat process for remaining bearings
Verify proper fit of all bearings
Tighten all cap bolts to final specification

result.note: Bearings that are too tight can cause rapid babbitt wear.

ol.li: Run the motor slowly for approximately two hours
Maintain proper water and oil levels during break-in
